products.name: ARIA CORE
products.description: Oncology information system (OIS) / specialty EHR for radiation oncology, medical oncology, and surgical oncology departments. Manages clinical, administrative, and financial workflows for cancer treatment. Evolved from legacy ARIA OIS platform. Includes modules for systemic therapy management (cloud-native), mobile access, and connects to ARIA CORE Insights analytics and Noona patient engagement.
products.broader_product_name: ARIA CORE Digital Oncology Platform (includes ARIA CORE, ARIA CORE Mobile, ARIA Systemic Therapy Management, connects to ARIA CORE Insights and Noona)
products.notes: ARIA CORE is the next-gen version of the legacy ARIA OIS. It is typically deployed in hospital radiation oncology departments alongside Varian linear accelerators and integrates with the hospital's general EHR (Epic, Cerner, etc.) via HL7/DICOM. Stores exceptionally deep radiation therapy delivery data (machine parameters, beam configurations, dose distributions) that has no equivalent in general EHRs. Also has built-in charge capture, billing code management, and practice management integration. Certified for FHIR APIs (g)(7), (g)(9), (g)(10) and patient portal (e)(1).

products.name: Noona
products.description: Oncology-focused patient engagement platform for remote symptom monitoring, patient-reported outcomes (ePROs), and treatment information sharing. Mobile app (iOS/Android) available in 12 languages. Integrates with ARIA CORE or other hospital information systems.
products.broader_product_name: ARIA CORE Digital Oncology Platform (Noona is the patient engagement component)
products.notes: Originally developed by Finnish company Noona Healthcare, acquired by Varian. Cloud-native application. Key unique data: patient-reported symptoms/outcomes, side-effect photos, and questionnaire responses that originate in Noona and may not exist elsewhere. Certified only for (b)(10) EHI export, (e)(1) patient portal, and basic security/platform criteria. Can integrate with non-Varian hospital systems as well.

Theranostics page showing how ARIA CORE, STM, Noona, and Insights work together for radiopharmaceutical therapy.

notes: Varian Medical Systems was acquired by Siemens Healthineers in April 2021 for ~$16.4B. Varian is the global leader in radiation oncology technology (linear accelerators + oncology software). ARIA is typically deployed in hospital cancer centers alongside Varian treatment machines and integrates with the hospital's main EHR via HL7/DICOM. The ARIA CORE platform is the evolution of the legacy ARIA OIS, with cloud-native modules (STM, Insights) being added. The certified products (ARIA CORE and Noona) are part of a broader 'Digital Oncology' ecosystem that also includes Eclipse treatment planning, ARIA CORE Mobile, ARIA CORE Insights analytics, and ARIA Systemic Therapy Management.
